Citation.Originator: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division, Spatial Products Systems Branch
Citation.Title: TIGERweb Application

Description.Abstract:
The TIGERweb application allows users to access and view geospatial features, geographic area information, and associated attributes from the U.S. Census Bureau Topologically Integrated Geographic Encoding and Referencing System (TIGER) geodatabase. The TIGERweb Decennial application is intended to meet the needs of users inside and outside the Census Bureau for access to geospatial data contained within the TIGER geodatabase without requiring the use of a GIS. The TIGERweb map layers are grouped by the following geographies: Transportation (Roads and Railroads) PUMAs, UGAs, and ZCTAs Tribal Census Tracts and Block Groups Census Tracts and Blocks Military and other Special Land Use Areas School Districts Places and County Subdivisions American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Areas Legislative Areas Census Regions and Divisions Urban Areas Metropolitan and Micropolitan Statistical Areas and Related Statistical Areas Hydrography States and Counties
Labels are included for the map layers. These layers contains the latest version of legally defined areas reported to the Census Bureau and reflect the governmental units in effect as of January 1, 2014 or legal or statistical boundaries that have adjusted or corrected since the 2010 Census. Physical features like hydrography, transportation and special land use areas like military reservations reflect updates as of September 2014.
In addition to the January 1, 2015 vintage (ACS 2015), the TIGERweb application also contains data as of January 1, 2014 (ACS 2014) and data as of January 1, 2010 (2010 Census).
This application contains two vintages of data. The 2010 Census consists of data as of January 1, 2010. The Census 2000 vintage consists of data as of January 1,2000 that has been adjusted and/or corrected since Census 2000.
Description.Purpose: To allow the users to visualize our TIGER(Topologically Integrated Geographic Encoding and Referencing database) data. This application allows users to select features and view their attributes, to search for features by name or geocode, and to identify features by selecting them from a map. This application provides a simple way to view our TIGER data without having to download the data.

Theme.Theme_Keyword: Combined New England City and Town Areas
New England City and Town Area Divisions
Metropolitan New England City and Town Areas
Micropolitan New England City and Town Areas

Constraints.Other_Constraints: This product is free to use. Acknowledgement must be given to the U.S. Census Bureau as the source. The boundary information is for visual display at appropriate small scales only. Files should not be used for geocoding addresses. Files should not be used for determining precise geographic area relationships.

Point_of_Contact.Contact_Organization: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division
U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division

Distribution_Information.Distribution_Liability: The TIGERweb application allows users to access and view geospatial features, geographic area information, and associated attributes from the U.S. Census Bureau Topologically Integrated Geographic Encoding and Referencing System (TIGER) geodatabase. In order to do this, a web browser must be used. For information on how to use the web browser, contact the manufacturer of the web browser.
Distribution_Information.Fees: There are no fees associated with this product
Distribution_Information.Technical_Prerequisites: A web browser is needed to use this application

Metadata_Reference_Information.Metadata_Hierarchy_Level_Name: This is an application that can be used to view TIGER\Line data

Contact_Address.Contact_Organization: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division
